thread.title: Local sports roundup: Benzie girls win at Allendale
thread.title_full: Local sports roundup: Benzie girls win at Allendale

author: FROM STAFF REPORTS
title: Local sports roundup: Benzie girls win at Allendale
text:
Local sports roundup: Benzie girls win at Allendale FROM STAFF REPORTS Record-Eagle.com 
ALLENDALE — Benzie Central's girls won the Allendale Falcon Invitational, while the boys were second. 
The Huskies were without one of their top five boys runners for the 17-team cross country meet Saturday. 
Division 4 No. 1-ranked Saugatuck won the boys meet with 50 points to Benzie's 71, with No. 4-ranked Shepherd third with 78. 
Brayden Huddleston won in 15:45, taking the lead with about 800 meters remaining. He's won back-to-back races heading into the Portage Invitational next weekend. 
Jake Williams (16:25.37) was fifth, Jeffery Crouch (16:45.8) took 11th, Hayden Bretzke (17:28.4) was 23rd and Pedro Roman (17:46.91) 31st. 
Benzie's girls won with 52 points, six ahead of runner-up Saugatuck. Shepherd was third with 71. 
The Huskies' first four girls finishes in under 20 minutes, the first time Benzie has accomplished that is several years, coach Asa Kelly said. 
Benzie was led by Stephanie Schaub (fifth, 19:42.64), Lucy Karpukhno (seventh, 19:45.32), Mary Claire Smeltzer (ninth, 19:51.56), Olivia Brian (11th, 19:54.65) and Ashley Nye (21st, 20:58.39). 
USPHL 
Kalkaska 6 
Michigan 4 
Colton Coates and Daystar Smallboy scored two goals each as the Kalkaska Rhinos defeated the Michigan Wild 6-4 Saturday night. 
Darren Aikens and Matt Culot added Rhinos goals. Austin Hannaford made 11 saves and Caleb Barris 19 for Kalkaska. 
Two of Michigan's goals came in the final 1:10 with an empty net. 
— Compiled by James Cook With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
